description:
Immunohistochemistry (IHC) is a method that combines biochemical, histological and immunological techniques into a simple but powerful assay for protein detection. IHC provides valuable information as it visualizes the distribution and localization of specific cellular components within cells and in proper tissue context.

 

This protocol describes the steps for performing the immunohistochemistry method with frozen tissue sections.
guidelines: Tissue preparation is a key to successful IHC experiments. Since no universal tissue preparation method will be ideal for all sample and tissue types, the protocol given here is intended as a starting point from which the experimenter must optimize as needed. All conditions should be standardized in order to ensure reproducible results. Keep in mind that you must be careful not to allow tissues to dry out at any time.
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working.

components.data: Sample Preparation - Snap Freezing and OCT Embedding
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Sample Preparation - Snap Freezing and OCT Embedding

components.data: Harvest fresh tissue and place it in a dish filled with ice-cold PBS buffer (AR0030, Boster Bio).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Harvest fresh tissue and place it in a dish filled with ice-cold PBS buffer (AR0030, Boster Bio).

components.data: Sample Preparation - Snap Freezing and OCT Embedding
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Sample Preparation - Snap Freezing and OCT Embedding

components.data: Wash the tissue thoroughly with PBS to remove blood. Use forceps to remove connective tissues.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the tissue thoroughly with PBS to remove blood. Use forceps to remove connective tissues.

components.data: Sample Preparation - Snap Freezing and OCT Embedding
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Sample Preparation - Snap Freezing and OCT Embedding

components.data: Cut the tissue into slices with the thickness of 3 mm or less.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cut the tissue into slices with the thickness of 3 mm or less.

components.data: Sample Preparation - Snap Freezing and OCT Embedding
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Sample Preparation - Snap Freezing and OCT Embedding

components.data: Immediately snap freeze the tissue in iso-pentane cooled in dry ice and keep the tissue at -70°C. Do not allow frozen tissue to thaw before cutting.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Immediately snap freeze the tissue in iso-pentane cooled in dry ice and keep the tissue at -70°C. Do not allow frozen tissue to thaw before cutting.

components.data: Sample Preparation - Snap Freezing and OCT Embedding
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Sample Preparation - Snap Freezing and OCT Embedding

components.data: Prior to cryostat sectioning, position the tissue in a mold (which can be simply made by using tin foil) and cover the tissue completely in Optimal Cutting Temperature (OCT) embedding medium.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prior to cryostat sectioning, position the tissue in a mold (which can be simply made by using tin foil) and cover the tissue completely in Optimal Cutting Temperature (OCT) embedding medium.

components.data: Sample Preparation - Snap Freezing and OCT Embedding
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Sample Preparation - Snap Freezing and OCT Embedding

components.data: Use forceps to take the bottom part of the mold into liquid nitrogen for 1 to 2 minutes. The OCT should change to white.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Use forceps to take the bottom part of the mold into liquid nitrogen for 1 to 2 minutes. The OCT should change to white.

components.data: Sample Preparation - Cryostat Sectioning
components.name: Section

components.data: Pre-cool a slicer box and detector to -22°C and -24°C respectively. Ensure the completeness and smoothness of the blade.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pre-cool a slicer box and detector to -22°C and -24°C respectively. Ensure the completeness and smoothness of the blade.

components.data: Sample Preparation - Cryostat Sectioning
components.name: Section

components.data: Place the tissue from the mold to the detector where the tissue is fixed.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the tissue from the mold to the detector where the tissue is fixed.

components.data: Sample Preparation - Cryostat Sectioning
components.name: Section

components.data:
Quickly and carefully slice the cryostat sections at 5-10 µm and mount them on gelatin-coated histological slides. Note that:

  • Use coverslip to take sliced tissue
  • Cryostat temperature should be between -15°C and -23°C
  • The sections will curl up if the specimen is too cold
  • The sections will stick to the knife if the specimen is too warm
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Quickly and carefully slice the cryostat sections at 5-10 µm and mount them on gelatin-coated histological slides. Note that:

  • Use coverslip to take sliced tissue
  • Cryostat temperature should be between -15°C and -23°C
  • The sections will curl up if the specimen is too cold
  • The sections will stick to the knife if the specimen is too warm

components.data: Sample Preparation - Cryostat Sectioning
components.name: Section

components.data: Air dry the sections at room temperature for 30 minutes to prevent them from falling off the slides during antibody incubations.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Air dry the sections at room temperature for 30 minutes to prevent them from falling off the slides during antibody incubations.

components.data: Sample Preparation - Cryostat Sectioning
components.name: Section

components.data:
Store the slides at -70°C. Note that:

  • The slides can be stored unfixed for several months at -70°C
  • Frozen tissue samples saved for later analysis should be stored intact
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Store the slides at -70°C. Note that:

  • The slides can be stored unfixed for several months at -70°C
  • Frozen tissue samples saved for later analysis should be stored intact

components.data: Sample Preparation - Cryostat Sectioning
components.name: Section

components.data: Immediately add 50 µL of ice-cold fixation buffer to each tissue section upon removal from the freezer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Immediately add 50 µL of ice-cold fixation buffer to each tissue section upon removal from the freezer.

components.data: Sample Preparation - Cryostat Sectioning
components.name: Section

components.data: Fix frozen section by immersing it into 4% paraformaldehyde (AR1068, Boster Bio) at 2-8°C for 8 minutes (or optimally at -20°C for 20 minutes).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Fix frozen section by immersing it into 4% paraformaldehyde (AR1068, Boster Bio) at 2-8°C for 8 minutes (or optimally at -20°C for 20 minutes).

components.data: Sample Preparation - Cryostat Sectioning
components.name: Section

components.data: Wash the section 3X with PBS and allow it to dry at room temperature for 30 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the section 3X with PBS and allow it to dry at room temperature for 30 minutes.

components.data: Sample Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: This fixation procedure using paraformaldehyde and formalin fixatives may cause autofluorescence in the green spectrum. In this case, you may try fluorophores in the (i) red range or (ii) infrared range if you have an infrared detection system.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: This fixation procedure using paraformaldehyde and formalin fixatives may cause autofluorescence in the green spectrum. In this case, you may try fluorophores in the (i) red range or (ii) infrared range if you have an infrared detection system.

components.data: Inactivation
components.name: Section

components.data: Mix H2O2 with distilled water (v/v: 1:50).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix H2O2 with distilled water (v/v: 1:50).

components.data: Inactivation
components.name: Section

components.data: Immerse frozen sections or cell climbing slices into the diluted H2O2 at room temperature for 10 minutes
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Immerse frozen sections or cell climbing slices into the diluted H2O2 at room temperature for 10 minutes

components.data: Inactivation
components.name: Section

components.data: Wash the section 3X with distilled water (1 minute each).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the section 3X with distilled water (1 minute each).

components.data: Antigen Retrieval (Proteolytic Induced Epitope Retrieval: PIER)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Antigen Retrieval (Proteolytic Induced Epitope Retrieval: PIER)

components.data: Dry the frozen sections with filter paper.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dry the frozen sections with filter paper.

components.data: Antigen Retrieval (Proteolytic Induced Epitope Retrieval: PIER)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Antigen Retrieval (Proteolytic Induced Epitope Retrieval: PIER)

components.data: Add compound digestion solution (AR0022, Boster Bio) (e.g. Trypsin solution or other enzymatic antigen retrieval solution) to the sections or slices.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add compound digestion solution (AR0022, Boster Bio) (e.g. Trypsin solution or other enzymatic antigen retrieval solution) to the sections or slices.

source_data.reagent_name: Antigen Retrieval Buffer (Enzymatic Digestion) For IHC

components.data: Antigen Retrieval (Proteolytic Induced Epitope Retrieval: PIER)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Antigen Retrieval (Proteolytic Induced Epitope Retrieval: PIER)

components.data: Incubate the sections at room temperature for 3 to 5 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate the sections at room temperature for 3 to 5 minutes.

components.data: Antigen Retrieval (Proteolytic Induced Epitope Retrieval: PIER)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Antigen Retrieval (Proteolytic Induced Epitope Retrieval: PIER)

components.data: Wash the sections with 3X PBS (5 minutes each).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the sections with 3X PBS (5 minutes each).

components.data: Blocking
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 5% BSA blocking solution or normal goat serum to the PIER treated samples.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 5% BSA blocking solution or normal goat serum to the PIER treated samples.

components.data: Blocking
components.name: Section

components.data: Incubate the samples at 37°C for 30 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate the samples at 37°C for 30 minutes.

components.data: Blocking
components.name: Section

components.data: Discard extra liquid (No washing required).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Discard extra liquid (No washing required).

components.data: Primary Antibody Incubation
components.name: Section

components.data: Dilute primary antibody with antibody diluent (AR1016, Boster Bio) to the concentration recommended by the antibody manufacturer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dilute primary antibody with antibody diluent (AR1016, Boster Bio) to the concentration recommended by the antibody manufacturer.

source_data.reagent_name: Antibody Dilution Buffer With BSA, Reducing Background

components.data: Primary Antibody Incubation
components.name: Section

components.data: Add the diluted antibody to the samples and incubate at 37°C for 30 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add the diluted antibody to the samples and incubate at 37°C for 30 minutes.

components.data: Primary Antibody Incubation
components.name: Section

components.data: Wash the samples 2X with PBS (20 minutes each).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the samples 2X with PBS (20 minutes each).

components.data: Secondary Antibody Incubation
components.name: Section

components.data: Dilute biotinylated secondary antibody with antibody diluent (AR1016, Boster Bio) to the concentration recommended by the antibody manufacturer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dilute biotinylated secondary antibody with antibody diluent (AR1016, Boster Bio) to the concentration recommended by the antibody manufacturer.

source_data.reagent_name: Antibody Dilution Buffer With BSA, Reducing Background

components.data: Secondary Antibody Incubation
components.name: Section

components.data: Add the diluted antibody to the samples and incubate at 37°C for 30 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add the diluted antibody to the samples and incubate at 37°C for 30 minutes.

components.data: Secondary Antibody Incubation
components.name: Section

components.data: Wash the samples 2X with PBS (20 minutes each).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the samples 2X with PBS (20 minutes each).

components.data: Staining
components.name: Section

components.data: Add Strept-Avidin Biotin Complex (SABC) HRP-conjugated or AP-conjugated reagents to the samples.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add Strept-Avidin Biotin Complex (SABC) HRP-conjugated or AP-conjugated reagents to the samples.

components.data: https://www.bosterbio.com/catalogsearch/result/?q=sabc+hrp
components.name: External Link

components.data: https://www.bosterbio.com/catalogsearch/result/?q=sabc+alkaline+phosphatase
components.name: External Link

components.data: Staining
components.name: Section

components.data: Incubate the samples at 37°C for 30 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate the samples at 37°C for 30 minutes.

components.data: Staining
components.name: Section

components.data: Wash the samples 3X with PBS (20 minutes each).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the samples 3X with PBS (20 minutes each).

components.data: Staining
components.name: Section

components.data: Add a suitable amount of DAB reagent (AR1025, AR1022, Boster Bio) to the samples and incubate in darkness at room temperature for 10 to 30 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add a suitable amount of DAB reagent (AR1025, AR1022, Boster Bio) to the samples and incubate in darkness at room temperature for 10 to 30 minutes.

components.data: https://www.bosterbio.com/catalogsearch/result/index/?applications=17&q=dab+chromogenic
components.name: External Link

components.data: Staining
components.name: Section

components.data: Monitor the tissue staining intensity under a bright-field microscope.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Monitor the tissue staining intensity under a bright-field microscope.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 36 of IHC-F Protocol
source_data.annotation: If the staining background is too high, wash the section 4X with 0.01-0.02% TWEEN 20 PBS and 2X with pure PBS after the SABC reaction and before DAB staining. Then use DAB to stain the samples.
source_data.thread_text: If the staining background is too high, wash the section 4X with 0.01-0.02% TWEEN 20 PBS and 2X with pure PBS after the SABC reaction and before DAB staining. Then use DAB to stain the samples.
source_data.body: If the staining background is too high, wash the section 4X with 0.01-0.02% TWEEN 20 PBS and 2X with pure PBS after the SABC reaction and before DAB staining. Then use DAB to stain the samples.

components.data: Staining
components.name: Section

components.data: Wash the samples 3X to 5X with distilled water
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the samples 3X to 5X with distilled water

components.data: Staining
components.name: Section

components.data:
Counterstain (if necessary)

  • Add haematoxylin (AR0005, Boster Bio) to the sample
  • Dehydrate
  • Immerse the paraffin sections 2X in dimethylbenzene (7 minutes each)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Counterstain (if necessary)

  • Add haematoxylin (AR0005, Boster Bio) to the sample
  • Dehydrate
  • Immerse the paraffin sections 2X in dimethylbenzene (7 minutes each)

components.data: Staining
components.name: Section

components.data: Check the tissue staining intensity under a bright-field microscope.
